decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly establish board presence and disrupt opponents' strategies by using a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. It focuses on applying early pressure while also maintaining control over the opponent's actions through cards like Consign to Memory and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Phelia and Phlage to close out games quickly. With a mix of aggressive threats and disruptive elements, it seeks to overwhelm opponents before they can fully execute their game plan.

This deck focuses on using Eldrazi Temple and other ramp tools to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. It also includes control elements like Malevolent Rumble and Sowing Mycospawn to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with high-powered threats while controlling the board and ensuring a steady stream of mana to cast its big spells. It combines ramp and control elements to create a powerful and versatile strategy in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It heavily relies on leyline cards to enhance the efficiency of its creatures and control spells. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer allows for fast and consistent damage output. Additionally, the deck features a variety of lands to support its mana fixing needs. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells and removal options.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature plays while utilizing disruptive elements to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It aims to pressure the opponent with efficient threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd while disrupting their game plan with cards like Solitude and Galvanic Discharge. Additionally, the deck has a slight control aspect with cards like Consign to Memory and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and disruptive elements to secure victory.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disruption and card advantage through counterspells, removal, and card draw. The deck aims to control the game by using spells like Force of Negation and Unholy Heat to deal with threats, while also utilizing cards like Quantum Riddler and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate card advantage. The inclusion of creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Consign to Memory provides additional flexibility in dealing with opposing threats. Overall, the deck is built to outvalue and outlast opponents through careful resource management and efficient answers.

This aggro deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies while quickly dealing damage with powerful creatures like Ragavan, Phage, and Phelia. It utilizes a variety of removal spells and control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler to keep opponents off-balance. The deck is designed to apply pressure early and maintain board control throughout the game, with cards like Solitude providing additional protection. With a mix of aggression and disruption, the goal is to overwhelm opponents and secure a victory before they can stabilize.

The main focus of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to control the board with disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also pressuring the opponent with efficient creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Nethergoyf. The deck also utilizes the powerful land Urza's Saga to search for additional threats or utility artifacts. Using a mix of removal spells and hand disruption, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong board presence to quickly close out games.

This deck focuses on using a variety of creatures with unique abilities to create powerful synergies and combos. By utilizing cards like Malevolent Rumble, Dredger's Insight, and Agatha's Soul Cauldron, players can manipulate their graveyard and draw cards while building up their board presence with creatures like Grist, the Hunger Tide, Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, and Walking Ballista. The deck also includes tools to protect and support its creatures, such as Wall of Roots and Orcish Bowmasters. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through its versatile creature toolbox.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent through fast creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to finish off opponents. Violent Urge and Slickshot Show-Off can help deal additional damage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to be efficient and aggressive, utilizing cards like Mutagenic Growth to pump up creatures and close out games quickly. The overall strategy is to be relentless in attacks and quickly burn opponents down before they can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on using ramp spells like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also utilizes control elements such as Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while also controlling the board to secure victory. The deck's strategy revolves around efficiently ramping into big threats and maintaining control of the game through disruption and powerful creatures.

The deck aims to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand using Goryo's Vengeance and Faithful Mending, while also disrupting the opponent with spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation. Ephemerate and Solitude provide additional protection and removal, while Quantum Riddler and Psychic Frog help with card advantage and filtering. The deck can also use Prismatic Ending for versatile removal. The mana base includes fetch lands to ensure consistency in casting spells, with a slight black-white splash for additional versatility. The deck focuses on efficiently executing its game plan and outpacing opponents with its powerful combos.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost, efficient creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure early on, while also including burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart for direct damage. The deck also includes cantrips like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to smooth out draws and maintain card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy, allowing for consistent casting of spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mixture of disruption and control elements. Using cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Quantum Riddler, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Prismatic Ending and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly close out games. Additionally, the deck utilizes various lands and spells to provide versatility and consistency in its strategy.

The main concept of this Broodscale Bloodchief combo deck is to ramp up mana quickly using Eldrazi Temple and other lands, while using a variety of creature spells and artifacts to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to assemble key pieces such as Basking Broodscale and Emrakul, the Promised End to create powerful combos that can overwhelm the opponent in a short amount of time. Malevolent Rumble and other removal spells help to keep the opponent's board clear while setting up for the win condition.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker early in the game. It also utilizes control elements such as Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating value. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while maintaining control of the game through versatile spells and abilities. It combines the ramping power of Eldrazi with control elements to dominate the mid to late game.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, while also utilizing spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart for direct damage. Cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Slickshot Show-Off help to dig through the deck for key pieces, while Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge provide additional pump effects for your creatures. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain a fast-paced aggressive strategy throughout the game.
